results.title: Leaving Tropeoulhos
results.creator_credit: Anastasia Solomidis and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Anastasia and her husband lived in a village in Greece. One day a government official arrived to ask whether they would consider migrating to Australia. They talked about it and decided that they had better take up this opportunity to improve their lives and provide opportunities for their children.
results.description: Anastasia and her husband lived in a village in Greece. One day a government official arrived to ask whether they would consider migrating to Australia. results.title: Qesa: stories from the Craig Family Centre
results.brief_description: The African nation of Sudan has suffered the longest periods of sustained civil war in history. In this compilation of digital stories, women from North and South Sudan recount their experience of war, migration and settlement in Australia.

results.title: Wise woman
results.creator_credit: Hannan Kuea and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Hannan’s grandmother was a wise woman and a great storyteller who would tell Hannan ghost stories as a young girl in Sudan. This story was produced in association with the Craig Family Centre and funded by VicHealth.

results.title: Sudan: a new vision
results.creator_credit: Nychuat Deng and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: A lot of people made sacrifices in an attempt to free South Sudan from civil war. Nychuat and her family now live in Australia but they are deeply connected to Sudan and in honour and respect for those that have made sacrifices, they work tirelessly to support the freedom movement in Sudan. This story explores Nychaut’s relationship with her two countries, Australia and Sudan.

results.title: Qesa story
results.creator_credit: Yvonne Kyriakos and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Qesa means story in Arabic and Yvonne Kyriakos from the Craig Family Centre believes that it is the stories that come with the newly arrived communities that helps them to connect not only with their own communities but also with their new communities. The Centre offers support and assistance with empathy, respect and appreciation of these stories which share past experiences, cultures and traditions.

The Centre offers support and assistance with empathy, respect and appreciation of these stories which share past experiences, cultures and traditions.

results.title: My grandmother
results.creator_credit: Elizabeth Leek and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Elizabeth lived with her grandmother in a little village in Sudan. This story is a dedication to her grandmother, a woman who taught her many things.

results.title: Dancing again
results.creator_credit: Hannan Kuea and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Hannan Kuea reminisces about her childhood and life in Sudan and especially her wedding day - this very special day to be the last of the families getting together in Sudan before the married couple move on to Kenya and finally to Australia. On this wedding day the families (one side from North Sudan, the other from South Sudan) danced their traditional tribal dances in celebration. It would be many years later before the families reunite to dance once again in their new land on the other side of the world.
results.description: Hannan Kuea reminisces about her childhood and life in Sudan and especially her wedding day - this very special day to be the last of the families getting together in Sudan before the married couple move on to Kenya and finally to Australia. On this wedding day the families (one side from North Sudan, the other from South Sudan) danced their traditional tribal dances in celebration. It would be many years later before the families reunite to dance once again in their new land on the other side of the world.

results.title: The Cows of Sudan
results.creator_credit: Mary Hoth and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Nayaluak Beche recounts her farming life in Sudan where the women milk the cows and the men farm the land. She describes the cultures and traditions of women growing up in Sudan, her marriage and subsequent children and grandchildren and her decision to finally leave her homeland to join her daughter in Australia.
results.description: Nayaluak Beche recounts her farming life in Sudan where the women milk the cows and the men farm the land. She describes the cultures and traditions of women growing up in Sudan, her marriage and subsequent children and grandchildren and her decision to finally leave her homeland to join her daughter in Australia.

results.title: The Blue Nile
results.creator_credit: Kathrine Deng and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Through civil war Kathrine’s family are forced to change their lives, language and religion and eventually their country. Kathrine and her family are now living in Australia and they feel safe and have a chance to realise their dreams. Kathrine wants to make sure her children understand their cultural heritage and hopes that one day she can show them the Blue Nile.
results.description: Through civil war Kathrine’s family are forced to change their lives, language and religion and eventually their country. Kathrine wants to make sure her children understand their cultural heritage and hopes that one day she can show them the Blue Nile.

results.title: The Watchers
results.creator_credit: Steven McGregor, Joe Weatherstone, AFTRS and Cath Moore
results.brief_description: In a world where all our desires are monitored, a teenage boy is inspired to cross the line. But The Watchers are out and they show him where his actions may lead. Cast: Wayne Pygram, Dane Sheddon, Nathaniel Dean, Wayne Blair. 35mm live action footage with digital effects created on SGI, Mac and PC. Original format 35 mm/colour.
